website_summaries.verdict: Affordable strings that are ideal for practice sessions or for novice players. Also nice for playing fun, upbeat tunes; but some longevity issues are possible.
pros: Light gauge strings that are easy for beginners to strum
Produce lively tone and earn praise for staying tuned
Price falls on the lower end of the spectrum
cons: Some durability concerns noted, as they may break with frequent playing
If you prefer sound with more bass, these may not be for you

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying a few different brands and styles of strings for my Seagull S6 original. I had kind of settled on the Elixir 80/20 strings but thought so would give these a try. I waited a little more than a week to write this because new strings need a little time to stretch and get settled in. I went with lights instead of custom lights. So far I am enjoying these. I like the mellower deeper sound I get.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Nice Balanced Tone.
customer_reviews.text: Got a couple of sets of the 4100's about a month ago. Needing a string change, I thought I'd try them out on my Yamaha FG730S. Replacing D'Addario EJ16's, the 4100's have a well balanced tone and very good projection. Different sounding than the EJ16's, that have a twangy bright metallic sound. They also feel a lot easier on the fingers for lights. They are a very good deal at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Zigfeldman

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I've played acoustic guitar since the early 60's, I teach and play out at least once a week so change strings at least once a month, do the math, I've tried them all and there are good ones out their, but I'm a Martin SP fan.
customer_reviews.author: bbjork

customer_reviews.title: Good strings. Might be great on the right guitar.
customer_reviews.text: I've been testing a lot of Martin strings recently and have had these on three different guitars. They sound a lot like the SP7100 (Lifespan) at roughly half the price. I don't need coated strings so these seem to work fine. I don't think I'm either excited or disappointed with them. Perhaps it's because each of my 3 acoustics sound and play radically different. I'd say they are decent strings at a good price. Longevity is average. I always change strings a day before an acoustic gig, so I usually don't keep strings longer than 2 weeks, three weeks max. If you aren't sure which strings you like I would encourage you to try these. You may like them.
customer_reviews.author: VincentTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Such a great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my wrist and hadn't been able to play for a couple years - bones looked like corn flakes. I finally healed enough, and those old strings sounded dead. Put these new ones on, and the "sing" is back in the strings. I still can't play without pain, but these strings make me want to keep trying. That old Martin Guitar sound is back.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: Tarnished and Defective!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Martin SP Phosphor Bronze light gauge strings for years....Saw these on Amazon and they were being sold at a good price. Each set I received from this seller were tarnished and the lower E strings in each package was defective which caused horrible intonation. I don't know where this seller gets his Martin guitar strings from (these strings were so bad that maybe they were manufactured somewhere else and falsely packaged as Martin guitar strings) but these strings weren't the excellent sounding strings that I usually purchase and expect from The Martin Guitar Company.
customer_reviews.author: Doug H. Hamer

customer_reviews.title: Are these knockoffs???
customer_reviews.text: My last set of Martin SP Acoustic Lights lasted 6 months without a broken string. I PUT THIS SET ON A WEEK AND A HALF AGO AND ALREADY REPLACED 3 STRINGS! I have been playing for almost 30 years, use Dunlop pics, and Martin SP phosphor bronze strings on my Martin. I have NEVER HAD STRINGS THIS BAD. What in the world is going on over there? MARTIN SP's are great strings, whatever crap strings they're selling here are not. Buy from your local store, not these guys.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Superb strings
customer_reviews.text: These sound exactly like Elixirs at a quarter the price. Absolutely excellent right out of the package - use them on all my acoustics now.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: Not an elite guitar mind, but these have worked well for me and lasted!
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Martin Guitar's recommended strings
customer_reviews.text: These are the strings Martin recommends for most of their acoustic guitars. I prefer this Light gauge set rather than the Medium set Martin recommends for my HD-28 'cause I play blues and like to bend and choke the strings. If you're a heavy strummer and like to play loud, use the Medium gauge instead. They sound a bit too bright when first installed, but they mellow out quickly. At only 0.025" diameter, I also appreciate the wound G-string (3). Plus, they're very affordable. I was paying more than $6/set for decent guitar strings in the early '70's. [E=0.012", B=0.016", G=0.025", D=0.032", A-0.042", E=0.054"]
customer_reviews.author: Michael Benner - Fearless Intelligence

customer_reviews.title: My go-to acoustic string!
customer_reviews.text: I love these strings, they are my choice for my acoustics, and my jazzbox when I'm not using flat-wound strings. They have a nice bright tone, and are very bendable. They also last a decently long time, considering when I play, my hands tend to get a bit clamy for some reason, and that corrodes the strings quicker. Especially for the $4 I paid for them, If you can get them for that price I would say stock up!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Winter

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Feel
customer_reviews.text: These strings were recommended by my luthier and now use them exclusively on both my Ovation and Takamine accoustics. They have a warm, yet bright tone and last for a long time. My luthier suggested these specifically since I'm an older guitar player with not-as-nimble hands and frequent sore fingers. These do nicely!
customer_reviews.author: D Rie

customer_reviews.title: Great string
customer_reviews.text: When I traded in my Alvarez and bought a new Martin, I stuck with my old standby string - John Pearse phosphor bronze light. And they played beautifully. When the local shop stopped carrying John Pearse, I picked up a set of D'Addario which I hadn't tried in years. And they were complete garbage - terrible sound on my Martin. Last time around I picked up some Martin SPs which again I hadn't tried in years - they sounded flat on the Alvarez. But they absolutely sing on a Martin. I didn't think anything would sound better than my old standby John Pearses. But these do. Martin SPs on a Martin - go figure, they work!
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Good strings but not my first choice
customer_reviews.text: I tried these string out because Amazon had a $2 MP3 promotional credit, they were cheap, and my usual choice of strings(D'Addario phosphor bronze) were out of stock. To me, the Martin strings don't sound as warm as the D'Addarios, especially in the lower strings (6-4). These strings also don't have the color-coded ball ends to help size the strings....if you don't have much experience changing strings, this maybe an issue if you get in a hurry and mix the strings up. For the price, I'd order them again if the D'Addarios were not available.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Best Sound loud or quiet
customer_reviews.text: I tried MANY kinds of strings..... These make my Yamaha ll6 A.R.E. sound its best FOR SURE. I got used to coated elixirs so my fingers get really soar when I use these BUT !!! The sound difference is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: electro freak

customer_reviews.title: Great Strings
customer_reviews.text: Just tried these for fun and turned-out to be quality strings for my Baby Taylor. The phosphor bronze coating gives a nice, classic, metallic ring, and they're fairly durable, though you should note that all "light" strings - which these are - will break if you put too much tension on them while stringing or tuning (I find, especially the G and B strings). So if they do snap while you're stringing, it's not necessarily the product's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Brought new life & sound to my guitar...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned/used several types of acoustic guitar strings over the past 10 years. My absolute favorite strings are Martin SP. I think the SP stands for "Studio Performance" but whatever it stands for...the sound quality is fantastic. These strings have great sustain and hold their tuning longer that many other strings. Also, I buy "Light" since I like their sound and are in the middle of pack in terms of tension (for bending notes). Amazon has the BEST prices for these strings too!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Al

customer_reviews.title: Can't go Wrong with Martin Strings
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. After buying a new guitar I needed to replace the strings with a lighter gauge. Martin has always been reputable in my mind for anything related to stringed instruments so I bought these. Easy to put on, easy to tune, and are easier on some long rested finger tips as they relearn playing the instrument.
customer_reviews.author: cbpsych

customer_reviews.title: Good strings for the money
customer_reviews.text: They are comfort on my fingers. And seem to last
customer_reviews.author: jontom

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent set of strings. Not to impressive thou. It's okay
customer_reviews.author: ExtendedRoar

customer_reviews.title: Nice Strings
customer_reviews.text: Strings sound good...we'll see how long they last...I'm use to Elixir Strings...let the comparing begin!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good strings.
customer_reviews.text: Nice strings. Martin makes good strings. But strings are a matter of preference.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Kind of average
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to guitar, This is only my third set of strings and they didn't really blow me away with those first few strums. I'm still developing an ear for this, but my last strings, Ernie Ball Earthwood mediums, impressed me more. Strings are probably very subjective, so that's just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: These fit my Yamaha acoustic guitar and sounded nice. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Bovine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These strings worked like a charm, and is a really great buy totally worth it seeing how cheap they are, I'm so happy I found some guitar strings that I can actually trust won't break and hit me in the face if I play to hard! The strings are great and I think anyone looking for really great cheap guitar strings these will be perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: melissa stewart

customer_reviews.title: ... install these on my Epiphone DR-100 and what a nice sounding upgrade from the ones it came with
customer_reviews.text: Got a chance to install these on my Epiphone DR-100 and what a nice sounding upgrade from the ones it came with. A little deeper tone, and not overly high pitched, just a great overall tone, but that is a personal preference. I'll probably continue buying these, great value compared to other strings on the market, and if they last a decent amount of time I'll be very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lead Therapy

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a musician, but my son has a guitar and has taken lessons on and off over the years. When he broke a string on his guitar I replaced all of them with these. They were a good price, seem to be good quality, and easy to install (after watching a YouTube video). He's back in business. Not much more I can say.
customer_reviews.author: Me Tell U

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Great for bright guitars
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my ESP X-tone zebrawood guitar and they sound amazing. They really help bring out the naturally bright tones in the wood. I mostly play acoustic rock, and these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: This one is better, but it may take a compromise of both ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it on a Taylor 301CE acoustic. I also use D'Addario strings and wanted to try something that didn't quite give me the same twangy highs on the high e string and b. This one is better, but it may take a compromise of both to get what I am seeking in tone (the ever elusive tone we all chase after). But all in all, I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ann-MarieTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good for D35 Martin
customer_reviews.text: These strings sound good. Description a little confusing calling it bridge pins instead of strings.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sprat

customer_reviews.title: My Personal Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different types of strings over the years, and Acoustic SPs are the ones that I always return to. They mellow from that "harsh" new tone to a crisp/warm tone very quickly, and hold true for quite a long time - long enough that I don't feel the need to go to a heavily coated string like the Lifespan line or Elixirs.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Best sound for Taylor 414
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these strings for several years. Taylor comes with the Elixir strings installed. I found that these Martins have a much better sound but do not last as long. However, though the Elixirs produced a consistent sound for months and months, the sound was not as interesting or colorful as the Martins. I have never amplified the Elixirs on the Taylor 414--it may be great. I did run the Martins amplified on the 414 and they were marvelous.
customer_reviews.author: Sports Book Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Gritty High E and B strings
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these strings for a number of years with no problem Restrung with a new set and the top two strings(high E and B) were all gritty?!? Very dissapointed as these have been my string of choice for many years. Awaiting a response from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Brit Tv Fan

customer_reviews.title: Martin strings are a great value.
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with Martin's SP strings, and I like the lights or extra lights. I'm a female with small hands and fingers, and although I have some serious callouses built up, the mediums are too hard on my fingers. And in spite of what all the 'guys' say, I put extra lights on my Taylor SP Mini, and it's much easier to play now and still sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Sunluvr

customer_reviews.title: These Acoustic strings were very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: These Acoustic strings were very easy to set up. In a matter of minutes I was back to playing the Eulalie. The sound is smooth and superior. The strings were the gauge they stated on the package.
customer_reviews.author: Delilah Dugo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect buy for those of us that are tired of hunting down the nearest music store.
customer_reviews.text: This strings came exactly as described, and not are they cheaper, but they take the stress out of trying to find the closest vendor that sales strings(and then hope they have the ones you are looking for)
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great strings for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I do not play very often so I am slow about replacing strings. I've used these strings before and have been happy with how long they last, as well as how good they sound. You have to re-tune them a few times when they are new, this is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Fallon

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are the strings that the representative from Martin Guitars told me to use when I bought my first Martin 4 years ago. I don't play very often, so they don't need to be changed as often. They remain bright and clear for a long time and they are the perfect weight for my acoustic guitar. I trusted what the representative from CF Martin directed and will continue to use this string.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree H.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful... While they last.
customer_reviews.text: These strings are absolutely gorgeous sounding... Very dynamic and lively. They only last about 3 weeks which is normal I suppose but after using elixirs which sound pretty much just as good but last literally 2-3 months... I've got to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Sounded nice, decent tone
customer_reviews.text: Decided to move away from the Elixirs and spend 1/3 the amount for the Acoustic SP's. Sounded nice, decent tone, but last no where as long as Elixirs, and miss out on the low end of the bass for the guitar I strung then on. I would recommend, but tough to go against the Elixirs for tone and life.
customer_reviews.author: Stealyerface

customer_reviews.title: You will not go wrong with these!
customer_reviews.text: The best strings ever! They last a long time and keep their tone well. I don't have to tune these nearly as much as others I have used. I have been using these strings for years now, on stage and in the studio. I have gotten a number of people to start buying these just by gifting them.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory L. Skelton

customer_reviews.title: Same as above.....The Martin Way...Or No Way!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT STRINGS...... I Use/Play an Old Martin D28...and these strings...Are Bar NON The Only Ones...for the Sounds...An Old Martin "Kicks Out"...Playing, Pickin BlueGrass Music! ONLY Way T,Go!!!!!!aka......The Martin Way.....or No Way! after 50 yrs pickin! LesH
customer_reviews.author: Les Holman

customer_reviews.title: Awful sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality from these strings on my Martin OMJM was extremely disappointing. I was shocked at how poorly my guitar, that normally sounds angelic, sounded very tiny, metallic and off putting
customer_reviews.author: anthony ciccarello

customer_reviews.title: I love using Bronze !
customer_reviews.text: I am a worship leader and love using the Phosphor Bronze light on my guitar. It handles pretty good, sometime I play hard and it holds up against hard strumming. I have always used Phosphor Bronze light at the beginning i had my G string breaking all the time, but after a quick tune up, things are working really good. I love the sound and feel of the bronze strings.
customer_reviews.author: jude

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are freaking awesome and they last lioe forever. They sound well and feel well. And its just great
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Carr

customer_reviews.title: keep on jamming!
customer_reviews.text: as expected from Martin products, this is a great set of strings. they are easy on the fingers and true to their tones they hold up to some pretty harsh playing and still don't go false packaging is simple and organized
customer_reviews.author: amazonfan

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for Great Strings
customer_reviews.text: I always look for a good deal on strings, and I was happy to find these! I'm a big fan of Martins; they last long enough and they give me the kind of sound I'm looking for. I play a Dean Acoustic Electric, and I love, love, LOVE these Martin SP's!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy B

customer_reviews.title: Strings live up to Martin reputation
customer_reviews.text: I've used these strings on all my acoustics and even gave some to a band mate. They seem to keep their tone for a long time and don't change the instrument tone like some strings I've tried. Like a lot of folks, I'm not that picky about my strings, but for those who are, this is a good light string that will sound great on your acoustic.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Holley

customer_reviews.title: ... had been using the Martin long life strings as recommended by Martin for my guitar but i didn't feel ...
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the Martin long life strings as recommended by Martin for my guitar but i didn't feel their sound quality lasted much longer than the acoustic SP version to justify three price. These sound just as good for about 1/2 the price.
customer_reviews.author: LFD

customer_reviews.title: these are what my M-36 needs
customer_reviews.text: These strings bring out both the highs and lows in my guitar. They give the sound of the guitars I hear on recordings. The light gage cut through the band "noise" very well with plenty of volume. I've played mediums for years but the lights improve both sound and volume on my guitar
customer_reviews.author: Penni Roth

customer_reviews.title: ... strings for my granddaughter for a used guitar of good quality so she could learn to play
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these strings for my granddaughter for a used guitar of good quality so she could learn to play. I am quite familiar with phosphor bronze and the quality of Martin products as a drummer and repair cymbals. Having replaced the old strings feel and tones were much better.
customer_reviews.author: David Martinez

customer_reviews.title: OK but not great
customer_reviews.text: I just put a set of these on my Martin DX 1AE and the sound is thin and wiry to me, if not slightly muted. I have another set but will use them only in a pinch. I like the Marquis more than these.
customer_reviews.author: sfmiguelito

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great price = Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: Only strings I use. Not super bright like the 80/20's. More subtle sound. Nice bass sound too. And the price is on point.
customer_reviews.author: D. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Best Strings
customer_reviews.text: Great strings. I have used these for two years on my guitar changing them every 3-6 months.
customer_reviews.author: The Wipps Family of Five

customer_reviews.title: What a super bright sound
customer_reviews.text: What a super bright sound! I bought the set to revive an old ultra-low quality guitar, but now it sounds much, much better. I would recommend to anyone that would like to up a notch or two in sound brightness. Buy it with your eyes closed and open your ears!
customer_reviews.author: Hannch

customer_reviews.title: I picked these strings up as a Daily Deal and they sound very good. Nice warm tone both with a pick and ...
customer_reviews.text: I just a novice when it comes to guitars. I picked these strings up as a Daily Deal and they sound very good. Nice warm tone both with a pick and just finger picking. These were the first strings I've used so I don't have a baseline to compare them to, but I would definitely buy them again. Overall I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Schaper

customer_reviews.title: ... was trying out a different gauge set and was happy that these sound very similar
customer_reviews.text: I usually use more expensive Elixar's but was trying out a different gauge set and was happy that these sound very similar. Doubt they'll last as long as the Elixar's do, but it's a good alternative when experimenting on what gauges work best for your guitar.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: absolutley specatacular
customer_reviews.text: these strings are as good as you would expect if you know anything about Martin Guitars! Makes my martin sound so much better than any other type of string I've used on that guitar. Probably would make your guitar sound better too, even if it is a GIBSON! or any other type of acoustic steel string guitar.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome strings makes inexpensive guitars sound great!
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet, I put these on my Yamaha FG700S and it sings! Great tone, brightness and projection. The stock strings on the guitar were pretty good, but the guitar sounds like a million bucks now. Give them a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Barnabas O'Collins

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright sounding strings.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Martin Marquis Lights for years on my Alarez Yairi , never wanting to try another kind. I must say I notice the difference right away when I put the MSP4100's on, how much brighter they sounded. Now that I know what they sound like on my Alarez, I'm going to put them on my Ovation.
customer_reviews.author: NickT

customer_reviews.title: Ringing tone.  A bit closer to medium than light.
customer_reviews.text: These strings have a beautiful ring. For light strings, however, they are tough to bend. For $6.00, who can complain? I am going to stick with them for a while and decide once my callouses get built up to the tougher strings whether or not to keep them. Their sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bier

customer_reviews.title: Martin MSP4100 Sp Phosphor Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings, Light
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of hunting before finally settling on these strings. For one thing, this is a pack of all six strings, instead of other packs that only have two or three. I'm still in the process of getting the string broken in like I like them, so it has definitely caused finger pains for the first few days. Everything else about these strings are great; they came quickly, they look and sound great right out of the box, and they're pretty reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Gragg

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Got these as a replacement for my acoustic guitar when the high E string broke. Went right on and sound good.
customer_reviews.author: yarz

customer_reviews.title: Fun playing and rich sound (of the 3 bass strings)
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful sound. Easy to string as they have the T-end. But watch-out, the G, B, and E strings are metal as well (I was under impression for classical guitar that they would be nylon but that's my overlooking.)
customer_reviews.author: O from Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Word of an Old Timer.
customer_reviews.text: They may not stay bright sounding as long as some more expensive sets, but if you don't mind changing strings a little more often they are a good choice. I don't pretend to be an expert, but I have played on a lot of strings since my first arch top Silvertone back in 1951. For the money they are worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Donald  Lattimer

customer_reviews.title: Great strings at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying these strings very much. I've installed them on a Fender DG-8s and they sound lovely. Lots of deep bass for light strings and they sound great when plucking or strumming.
customer_reviews.author: Pottsy

customer_reviews.title: Best for me
customer_reviews.text: So far, these are the best strings for sound and keeping in tune. The Martin Extra Lights are ok, but they don't stay in tune as well as these Lights, especially the B string. Great sound that makes my inexpensive guitar sound really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Senior rider.

customer_reviews.title: Beginner
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought medium on the suggestion of a guitar player. Not a good idea! I bought these and I can practice for at least 30 minutes. They have a deep full sound and look great as well. Of course it all depends on your guitar.
customer_reviews.author: ME, San Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound, longevity
customer_reviews.text: I've used phosphor bronze strings for more than 30 years and love them. These are very nice, last a good while even in a near-ocean environment.
customer_reviews.author: kh808

customer_reviews.title: Great strings!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for years on My old antique Martin guitar they seem to have the best intonaion and tone of all the brands i have tried and they usually last well too
customer_reviews.author: Stan Williams

customer_reviews.title: I'll be using these from now on.
customer_reviews.text: These are much better than the coated ones I tried and tried for a long time. They may not last as long as the coated ones but they play a lot better and in my opinion, they sound a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: D.Ayotte

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Replacement Strings
customer_reviews.text: Very good replacement strings. I am just learning guitar and found these here in Amazon and they were a good price. If you need replacement strings then these are a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: ... them to try on my Martin DC-16RGTE and didnt like them. I'll to stick to the "DR Rare" ...
customer_reviews.text: ehhh I bought them to try on my Martin DC-16RGTE and didnt like them. I'll to stick to the "DR Rare" strings.. The sound amazing and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: pnjcruz

customer_reviews.title: Martin DCX 1KE - Great Live Performance Strings
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally good strings. They're not coated, don't have special resistant chemicals, etc., they're simply beautiful phosphor bronze voiced strings. I use them exclusively on a Koa topped Martin and they are resounding. Deep enough for stand alone baritone sound and crisp and clear at the top end. I'm very hard on my guitar, I play a solo show setup, guitar in hand for sometimes 3+ hours at a time and these strings rarely ever break. Keep a good, sanded bridge and nut and there's little these thin guys won't stand up to. [...]
customer_reviews.author: tanner bechtel

customer_reviews.title: Good Strings.
customer_reviews.text: They are good strings. I made the mistake of getting these for a classical guitar, so I could not install them, but Martin makes good strings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri J

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great strings used them a lot and still haven't broken
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: I love the sound and feel of these strings
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT a professional guitar player. Having said that, I love the sound and feel of these strings. I have had my acoustic guitar for about 30 years, and these are my favorite strings.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: *plays Wonderwall in the middle of a college courtyard*
customer_reviews.text: I hate re-stringing my guitar. These strings don't make the process any different, but they sound nice, so I'll give Martin that.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Morgan

customer_reviews.title: I have been using these for years!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years! the new packaging makes me love it even more! sounds great. has a loud, deep, slightly twangy sound once you string it. after the strings settle into place and get used, the twangy sound fades away and then it sounds absolutely beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Ben D.

customer_reviews.title: great strings for a lighter sound
customer_reviews.text: great strings but a little to light for my ears, I prefer a deeper richer sound and should have purchased the medium's. my mistake not theirs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great strings! They are my top favorite and I have been using them for years!
customer_reviews.author: Chad1317

customer_reviews.title: Use on a mahogony guitar.
customer_reviews.text: These sound awesome on a mahogany guitar, and since they are phosphor bronze they will sound generally good on any guitar! they do last long as well, i had them on for 6 month before they started losing their sound. (which was still a minimal change) Great strings.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I use these on a 1947 martin 00018 and these sound amazing. they don't last as long as some of those coated strings, but the price is better and the sound is beyond worth changing the strings a little more often.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Mcbee

customer_reviews.title: Very good strings - I recommend
customer_reviews.text: Good strings that have a nice high ring to them - Not necessarily the best strings for jazz or blues - But sounds great for folk, acoustic rock, fingerstyle, and country.
customer_reviews.author: ritastew

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Here.
customer_reviews.text: For a beginner like me this was really good. I love the rustic and folk that is provided by the accoustic guitar. I haven't had any problems with having my hands go brown or whatever color people are saying. But I guess I just don't play as much as they do.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: The best atrings I've found for my Breedlove American OM/SM
customer_reviews.text: The best atrings I've found for my Breedlove American OM/SM. Not too bright, not too mellow. Accentuate everything I love about this guitar. Last a good while too, and for the money they are a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: my favorite string
customer_reviews.text: I love the tone and the longevity of these strings. Being a rather hard flatpicker (a habit I have a hard time breaking) over the course of 40 years, I used to break G and D strings 1-2 times during a 4 hour gig. I never break strings now, and I still get the great tone my 50 year old Martin can produce.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald B. Berdan

customer_reviews.title: World of difference between strings
customer_reviews.text: They are good for me right now because I am still learning guitar but what a world of difference between the strings
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't care for the tone with my Martin HD-28. I'll stick to the Marquis series strings.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Price

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: don't know what to say they still have not been put on.
customer_reviews.author: carla colin

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like quality strings
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like quality strings. So far only replaced out the one that was broken, but plan to do others soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ravens2006

customer_reviews.title: ... has used these for several years and is very satisfied. Good
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used these for several years and is very satisfied. Good, clear sound.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Good Strings
customer_reviews.text: They sound nice, hold a tune well, and seem to have good life to em. I am not really sure what else to say about guitar strings other than I feel like I got a good deal on some good strings.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dahlbeck

customer_reviews.title: Love them, they sound great!
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up on a deal of the day! Great product wish I had bought two more!
customer_reviews.author: Freedom2

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Good strings, good price. I have an acoustic/electric and I think these sound great. I am on my second pair because I broke the other set I had, my fault not the strings. I immediately just re-ordered these.
customer_reviews.author: RiverRat

customer_reviews.title: Nice strings. Great tone!
customer_reviews.text: Nice strings. Great tone. I forgot how much of a pain it is to change strings, but if you've got to do it, these are nice strings!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: not my personal favorite string, but couldn't pass up such a great ...
customer_reviews.text: can't beat the price, not my personal favorite string, but couldn't pass up such a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend these guitar strings
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend these guitar strings. This was only the second time that I've replaced the strings on my guitar, and I really enjoy playing with the new Martin strings. They are not as hard on the fingers as my last set was.
customer_reviews.author: Robwhite1181

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: got 4 my son he wanted them to make a pan and box guitars. he says they worked well.
customer_reviews.author: de

customer_reviews.title: Decent Strings for the price, go with Elixir.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were about 9 dollars less than the Elixir strings I usually buy but their sound just didn't do it for me. For the discounted price of 5.39 they are good strings but if money is not an issue, always go with Elixir.
customer_reviews.author: Jed

product_meta.title: Martin MSP4100 SP Phosphor Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings, Light
product_meta.description: Size:1 PackMartin MSP4100 Phosphor Bronze Light Acoustic Guitar Strings are made from a 92/8 composition alloy to give that brilliance, clarity, and longevity of sound required by serious guitarists. The phosphor bronze winding alloy is ideally suited for making strings that have deep, rich basses and clear, bright trebles that today's acoustic guitarists demand. Martin strings are high-quality strings designed for daily use. Martin acoustic guitar strings are wound to precise specifications. Core and wrap wires must meet strict requirements to make the grade.
feature_bullets: Bronze alloy for brilliance and long life
